adjective.description: (of a person or their actions) showing a deliberate and obstinate desire to behave in a way that is unreasonable or unacceptable, often in spite of the consequences.
examples: Kate's perverse decision not to cooperate

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense turned away from what is right or good): from Old French pervers(e), from Latin perversus turned about, from the verb pervertere (see pervert).
